meta.article_title: November 19, 2012 - Backhand and Forehand Playing Distance

playing_distance.probleme: Handling the combination of forehand looping and backhand hitting in a fast topspin rally
playing_distance.diagnostic: Hitters often play closer to the table than loopers, making it difficult to loop on the forehand side.

debutant.description: Practice moving diagonally back and forth with a partner or coach to develop this essential footwork.

debutant.nom: Learn to both hit and loop the backhand
debutant.description: Favor hitting the backhand when close to the table, and looping when farther away.

debutant.nom: Hit the backhand at the top of the bounce
debutant.description: Learn to hit the backhand at the same time as the forehand loop, for a natural distance.

debutant.nom: Loop the forehand at the top of the bounce
debutant.description: Learn to smoothly and rapidly loop the forehand, while hitting the backhand on the rise.

debutant.nom: Play the backhand with your feet in a slight forehand stance
debutant.description: Adjust your footwork to give yourself a head start for playing forehands, while still reacting to quick shots.

debutant.nom: Learn to loop the ball late in the forehand zone
debutant.description: Practice looping the ball near the back of the big forehand hitting zone, behind your body.

exercices_complementaires.description: Practice looping the forehand with a partner or coach, focusing on smooth and rapid loops.

erreurs_a_eviter.erreur: Playing the backhand too late, losing power and being rushed
erreurs_a_eviter.solution: Practice playing the backhand at the top of the bounce for a natural distance.
Practice moving diagonally back and forth with a partner or coach to develop this essential footwork.
